title: Genius!
review: After The Rock, This is the best movie I have ever seen, and it certainly deserves its place in the top 250 ranking. The plot is absolutely wonderful, and Kevin Spacey`s achievements in this movie rightfully gave him an Academy award. The ending of this movie is genius, and you will be extremely surprised when you see who Keyser Soze really is. You have to see this movie. It is a piece of fine art.

title: Deserves to be in top 10
review: I think this movie is excellent, it's one of my 10 favorite movies of all time. I will not spoil anything but, the ending caught me by complete surprise.And made me think, ahh it was so obvious but I've never would've guessed right. A very clever movie. 10/10

title: Keyser Soze rules the world
review:
An ex cop named Christopher McQuarrie (or maybe he's an ex-detective; I read this somewhere but I don't completely remember it) gets an idea about putting five super-criminals into a police line-up. He takes it to Bryan Singer, a director whom he collaborated with in Singer's first film PUBLIC ACCESS. Singer says that police lineups never have five super-criminals, they have the criminal and four people who share a resemblance. Then he thinks about it and says, wait a minute, under what circumstance would they be put in a line-up?

The result, THE USUAL SUSPECTS, is an enjoyable, twisty, thriller which is fun even as it entangles you in a complex plot, and then pulls the rug out with one more twist. Curiously, I guessed that twist, then dismissed it out of hand, and then was proven right! It did not stop me from enjoying it. It wasn't the best movie of that year (it was tied for #8 on my top ten with THE UNDERNEATH; ahead of it were LEAVING LAS VEGAS, NIXON, DEAD MAN WALKING, SMOKE, LE CONFESSIONAL, TWELVE MONKEYS, and THE BRIDGES OF MADISON COUNTY; behind it were ONCE WERE WARRIORS and SAFE), but it was the most fun. This had a lot of comparisons to RESERVOIR DOGS, but whereas that excellent film was an ironic take on old heist films, THE USUAL SUSPECTS plays it straight.

Everything comes together perfectly here; direction, writing (which assumes the audience is smart), music (which avoids most cliches when it comes to thrillers), colors, and yes, acting. All of it is top-notch, with of course special kudos going out to Kevin Spacey. Without ever "indicating," he creates a thoroughly believable cripple, plus he is a master storyteller, plus he's convincing both when he's defiant and when he's scared, or both, and when he's...but I should stop there. If you like being surprised and thrilled, this is for you.

title: shocking!
review: A simple construction at first, though it reveals a great finishing touch. I  watched the film twice and I believe every other time will be a new experience in order to catch a few more details.  Excellent acting by Kevin Spacey as Verbal Kint and the cast had none of a weakness.  To tell the truth the film deserves an A+ and that's for the thrill amd the cinematography!

title: Great Flick!
review: This movie is one of those you can watch almost any time, anywhere.  I loved the script, the acting and the direction.  What more can I say?  An all around great film.  If you haven't seen it and are reading these user comments to determine whether to rent it or not, take my advice, it's worth the rental charge.  If you can get your hands on the DVD, listen to the commentary by director Bryan Singer and screenwriter Chris McQuarrie.  They point out quite a few flaws and inconsistencies in the film that you probably never would have noticed.  Those two together are a bunch of clowns, but you can tell they love their work.

title: Kevin Spacey
review:
This is one of my all time favorite films. The script was great and worthy of its Oscar. Kevin Spacey is also one of the best actors alive and his Oscar was well deserved also.

I think that if any other actor portrayed Verbal Kint the ending wouldn't have worked as well. Spacey is the best in developing characters and becoming them (in my book). I didn't see the ending coming, largely due to the fact that Spacey had fooled us as well as Kujan the whole way.

The acting in this film is superb. Spacey lead the pack. Byrne, Baldwin, Palminteri, Pollack, and Del Toro also added great performances.

9.5/10

title: Wow, what a movie!
review:
Totally AWESOME! This is one of the greatest movies of all time. A VERY good ending, the best ending I have EVER seen. The story is entertaining and keeps you on the edge of your seat, as they keep switching back in time, to present day. Maybe a bit confusing, but if you follow it carefully then you'll really enjoy it. A must see!

** Brilliant 10/10 **

title: The greatest ending of a film... EVER!
review: Kevin Spacey delivers the performance of a lifetime as the suspect relating his tale of intrigue, betrayal and misplaced friendship, ending in one of the greatest final twists in film history.

title: Spacey, he's just out there..
review: Kevin Spacey has fast become one of my favorite actors. The Usual Suspects clinched him for a spot high on my list. His smug, deadpan expression just kills me. He's the perfect guy to play those "dead serious" characters that come off as so slick and intelligent.

title: Pure Genius
review:
The most hardened criminals in the world fear no one... except Keyser Soze. When 27 dead bodies are found in Long Beach Harbor with only one dying witness that utters the name Keyser Soze, the U.S. Customs Agent Daniel Kujan (Chazz Palminteri) has got to find the dreaded killer, but only one guy has the clues Verbal Kint (Kevin Spacey). A small-time crook, Verbal tells Kujan an incredible story of the job of their lives with and Keyser Soze at their backs. But somehow their job of a lifetime did not turn out as they expected and soon the five men, Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), McManus (Stephen Baldwin), Hockney (Kevin Pollak), Fenster (Benicio Del Toro), and Kint himself have to ask themselves: Who is Keyser Soze?

The plot and characters in the film are priceless. The amount of great actors in this movie is astounding, not to mention a great story with a surprising and impossible to guess ending. Kevin Spacey is the best of the bunch and flawless in his role as Verbal Kint and the extras are are also great. The movie continually startles with originality and dynamic sequences and make this a thrilling film. Director Bryan Singer and screenwriter Christopher McQuarrie (Both men worked on Public Access, winner of the 1993 Grand Jury Prize at Sundance) team up well with cinematographer Howard Cummings to create a brilliant and timeless crime story that should eventually be considered a classic of the genre.

title: Gold-plated classic
review:
Be warned - this is the ultimate thinking man's movie. It will leave the Roger Eberts of this world dumbfounded, confused and ultimately uncomprehending of its greatness.

Bold and showily complex, it is a no-kidding-around gold-plated classic - along the lines of "The Big Sleep" or "The Maltese Falcon." The movie involves a cop named Kujan (Chazz Palminteri) questioning a single witness, a shifty-eyed, club-footed criminal named Verbal, played by Kevin Spacey with the wounded innocence of a kid who ate all the cookies. Verbal tells a story so complicated that most people will fail to track of it; yet, it is a wonderful story, an elaborate tale of a heist involving a mythical, larger-than-life baddy named Keyser Soze and his manipulation of five hoods who get way in over their heads.

As Verbal talks, we see what he describes, and his story takes on an objective quality in our minds - we forget we're only getting his version.

The story is told in a series of flashbacks - director Bryan Singer and writer Chris McQuarrie show off their complex structural narrative with terrific performances from Benicio Del Tor, Gabriel Byrne, Stephen Baldwin, Kevin Pollak and Kevin Spacey. The story builds up to a blinding revelation, which shifts the nature of all that has gone before.

title: AWESOME!!!!
review: This film is amazing.  The end was a blow, and Spacey deserved the Oscar.  As to a critic in entertainment weekly that said this film was a caffienated ride through Tarentino land, I'd like to see him make a film this good.

title: Plot, plot, plot. 10/10!!!
review: In todays world of high tech, massive budget Hollywood garbage, this movie stands as a testament to the true source of good cinema. A brilliant story of five criminals as they are caught in a web of intrigue created by a figure who fascinates the audience as well as the characters. The kind of film that lingers in your mind and so well written that if it was storyboarded, a monkey could have directed it, it is a story and film that will be remembered. 10/10!!!

title: The smarter movie of the times!
review: The usual suspects: a great movie of kind: "who are the murder?", and you never will discover!!! Every detail of the history have a purpose... so this movie takes your attention until the end. If you appreciate suspense  movies like me, so this is the best! Course I have to comment about Kevin Spacey... he was sensational, perfect, and this movie changed his life. Well... don't wait! Rent this film now!!!

title: Breathtaking, and Deceptive... had me fooled
review: What a story line.  Great blend of mystery, suspense, humor, and  action. The ending will FLOOR you!  A must see!

title: See it. Multiple Times.
review: This has to be on of the best mysteries/action movies ever made.   The story that develops is so incredible that even after you see the unexpected ending, you are still mesmorized by it.  This is one of those flicks that gets better the more times you see it.  I don't know how anyone could have hated it or even mildly disliked it.

title: * * * * (four stars)
review:
An absolutely fantastic film. Few films have ever kept me so deeply engrossed as this movie did. Every minute is vital to the film, thus a trip to the restroom during it will leave you utterly lost when you return.

Five criminals, Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), McManus (Stephen Baldwin), Hockney (Kevin Pollak), Fenster (Benicio Del Toro), and Verbal (Kevin Spacey) are dragged into a lineup in New York for a hijacking. While in jail, they plan a job together that will get back at the cops. Eventually this leads them out to California, and into the hands of Keyser Soze. A mythical crime lord. The whole movie is told in flashbacks, by Kint. He is the last survivor of the group, and is relating the tale to Special Agent Kujon (Chazz Palminteri).

This is a movie that must be watched several times to be fully appreciated. The first time I saw it, I was utterly lost for the first half hour or so of the film. Now, after having seen it several dozen times, I still pick up little things that I've missed. Special mention must be made of Kevin Spacey's unparalleled acting in this movie, which he won a best supporting actor oscar for.

* * * * - classic, see it right away

title: The Unusual Movie
review: The Usual Suspects is for sure an unusual production.  I've heard from my friends how great this movie is but didn't get a chance to watch the video until recently.  I watched it twice within a couple of days.  Kevin Spacey's performance is formidable!  I would recommend this movies to everyone who has not yet seen it.

title: who is kaiser souze?
review: Though I am not a film critic, or an expert on the matter, this film is probably the best of all time.  Its impossible plot twists, and likable bad guys seem to make the movie fly buy.  the suspense drama turns into an unlikely comedy with the on liners of smart aleck crooks.  Kevin Spacey, Roger "Verbal" Kent, delivered an amazing oscar winning performance.  This movie keeps you guessing till the end, and surprising yourself every time that you see it.  Usual Suspects won me over, and I guarantee, it will do the same for you.

title: The best film ever seen
review: The maximun words for a message is 1,000 words.  I would need much more then that to say everything I have to say about this movie.  So lets start. Bryan Singer and Christopher McQuarrie has given us the best movie I have ever seen.  Directors now try to copy the film noir of the 40's and 50's. The Usual Suspects comes closest.  The acting in this is superb.  Kevin Spacey delivers the second best performance I have ever seen (behind Sameul Jackson in Pulp Fiction).  Kevin Pollack, who usually does garbage like House Arrest, but delivers a funny performance here.  Pete Pothleswaite is brilliant as Kobayashi and Chazz Palmenteri is also brilliant in his role. The script is unforgettable and memorable.  The way the scene changes is great and always keeps you guessing is convincing.  All in all **** out of 4 and is well worth it.  If you're stuck in the video store, don't go get garbage like Godzilla and Armageddon but go to the thriller section and get The Usual Suspects.  I promise you won't forget this movie.  The writing is unforgettable and the ending is mesmorizing.  Only Pulp Fiction, 12 Monkeys and Who Frammed Roger Rabbit has come close to beating The Usual Suspects for best movie but this is a gem that will always be number 1.

title: A tight, well scripted, thriller with a twist.
review:
This movie should be watched the first time for the surprise ending. It should be watched the second time for the clues and hints in the script. And it should be watched the third time for the clues and hints in the cinematography. And you can watch it after this just because it is a great movie. You can sense the energy and vision that went into the creation of the movie. This is a movie that doesn't follow any formulas, in the way shots are done, in the way the script was written and acted and in the way it was conceived.

I particularly like the flow of the dialogue. Unlike many Hollywood movies, the dialogue isn't cut line by line. (This is usually done to aid in editing.) In "The Usual Suspects" many scenes are shot with the dialogue overlapping, heightening the tension in the movie. The is particularly true in the interrogation scenes.

Great movie!

title: Would there be any way of giving this movie 11 !?!
review: This movie is the best movie I've ever seen! The acting was fabulous, the plot wonderfully written. Everything was spectacular.... Definitely a "MUST SEE" !!!!

title: Top Ten For Sure!!!
review: This movie is in my top ten favorites for sure!!!  I'm a big Kevin Spacey fan although I haven't seen too many of his movies. The Usual Suspects is the best crime movie I've ever seen with more twists and turns than Primal Fear, L.A. Confidential,and 12 Monkeys combined.  To watch this movie once is not enough.  I rented it and watched it twice in one day.  There was so much more that I picked up on the second time around and I think I could watch it fifty more times without picking up on everything.  Everyone in the movie did an incredible job, especially Kevin Spacey.  Kudos to both the writer and director for making one of the best films of all time!

title: This must be the absolute crime/film-noir movie
review: This is one of the best films I have ever seen! Brilliant performances, script and directing makes this film a modern classic. I particularly liked Gabriel  Byrne, a stunning performance, and Kevin Spacey. Both of them is on the list of my favorite actors.Bryan Singer is one hell of a director! I look forward to the day his new film " Apt Pupil" is released  here in TÃ¸nsberg. I don't bother to tell you what it is about. It would destroy a part of the feeling when you watch it. My highest recommendations! 10 out of 10!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Gripping Suspense movie with more twists than a pretzel factory
review: This movie is well done in every way, shape, and form.  Keeping a light and humorous tone while sucking the viewer in with the heavy intrigue, this movie will most definitely keep you on the edge of your seat until the end. The director keeps throwing in plot twists in an expert manner, keeping you guessing until the end.  Highly recommended.

title: A classic with a great artistic twist you'll never get
review: The Usual Suspects is not just your usual film of crims and crime and blowing things up. The show keeps you involved as more revelations come to the fore. With plenty of all the action and thrill that makes a movie great, the Usual Suspects also has a wonderfully thick plot with a twist at the end that you'll never see coming. After watching a movie with a twist, most people say it is not worth watching again. This film does not fit into that category. Although you may know the ending after the first enthralling time it is great to watch it again and see how the producer has interlinked everything that you would not have noticed the first time around. And even after watching it a second time, the film is that wonderful that you can keep watching it and never be sick of it as so many other thriller/action movies do. To date, I have watched it over 20 times and have never been bored watching it. It rates in the top 5 of my all time favourite movies and is a classic.

title: Intellectually stimulating, thrilling, entertaining....
review: "The Usual Suspects" is my favorite movie of all time for a number of reasons:  1) I was blown away the first time I watched it 2) I can spend hours discussing it 3) I have watched it almost 20 times and I never get tired of it 4) I always find something new when I watch it.  Those of you who are disillusioned with the movie because you can't completely grasp the plot, I don't think you realize that that's precisely the point of the movie.  After watching it once, go back over it and re-evaluate everything you saw the first time.  What is truth?  What is falsehood?  It never fails to make me think.  I appreciate that not everyone enjoys this type of movie, but as movies go, this is an EXCELLENT one, which, after viewing, made K.S. my favorite actor, Keyser my favorite villain (I definitely have a thing for villains!) and this movie my favorite movie of all time.

title: real good, real suspense
review: It is absolutely a smashing movie. I don't think I can go into details, because I have seen it only once. My video is now recording it, so I can have a better look at it.

title: One of the best films of all time!
review:
Finally, a thriller with every major ingredient: 1. A fantastic cast with excellent performances. 2. A director who knows how to tease and excite. 3. One of the most original plots with enough twists to keep you guessing. 4. An ending that totally surprises you.

I cannot express enough my love for this great film. Such a film that you can trade lines with friends (a group of my friends and I love to re-create the line-up scene). There are moments of thrilling action as well as sublime comedy that put your faith back into great movie-making. I recommend this fantastic film to anyone who values a great plot, great acting and a great ending. Previous viewers will agree with me no doubt. Join us.

title: A story skillfully told
review:
The duo of Singer and McQuarie created one of the most fascinating stories of the decade. The story exists for itself and the only intention is to be told. And that makes it unique.

The twists and turns in the movie are executed well, the timeline is excellent, Singer's direction is strong and he never loses the grip.

Ah, the actors. Spacey was always my favorite, his performance was duefully rewarded, Palminteri, Byrne, S. Baldwin, Pollack, Del Toro... everybody has his touch and they do their part flawless.

All in all, Usual Suspects is a very good story well told. A real teamwork of talents.

title: A Superior Quality Movie
review: This movie was one of the best ever made.  It contains a plot that is confusing enough that it need be watched twice to get the story.  The only bad reviews are coming from people who don't understand what happened.  I think this movie was one of the greats of all time.  Everyone should see it.

...

That is the sign for breathlessness. ......

Man, that was a good movie. My head has never felt so inwardly dizzy without some provocation on my behalf. ... That ending... Whoah...

This is how most people probably feel after watching this movie. Though from then on opinions change. Some people, those that are control freaks, will dislike it for its manipulation of the audience. But hey - Isn't that what this film is about? Verbal is manipulating the cop, and, you just happen to be listening in.

A superb movie 10/10 - A must see!

title: Possibly the grooviest film i've seen in years!
review: Frogboy's rating - 9/10 The Usual Suspects was probably one of the best crime movies ever. Filled with many plot twists and possibly the best ending I've ever seen. Great performances by Kevin Spacey, Gabriel Byrne, and Steven Balwin.  This film was very well written and directed.  I definitely recommend this film to anyone.  There rarely is a film that is this cool.

title: Perfection On Screen
review:
Why do these things happen? Why is the Academy so scared when it comes to giving crime thrillers the awards they so obviously deserve? Pulp Fiction, Se7en and Suspects. All these films shpuld have won best picture or director Oscars but got palmed off with screenplay and supporting awards. Se7en didn't even get a nomination for anything but editing. There isn't enough justice. But I'm not making my point, which is simply that Suspects is one of the best films ever made throughout the history of cinema. Full stop.

It is one of the ultimate (notice I'm not saying 'the ultimate') combinations of style, acting, directing, script, editing, music, and plot. from the very moment it starts with the flash of a match to its final heart stopping, jaw dropping, spine tingling finish, it hits you from all sides with magnificence. The characters are so brilliantly acted, the scenes so stunningly played and the story so cunningly told that you hardly have time to catch your breath before given some more cinematic excellence to digest.

Chris McQuarrie desrves much kudos for his creation. The story is so excellent and the script so wonderfully spot on that it's hard to imagine anybody making a bad film from it. But it is Bryan Singer's magnificent control over every aspect of the film that truly delivers the goods. He trusts his actors (all of which give stunningly sharp performances) to tell the audience something with a glance that others would need 15 minutes of dialogue to say. The clues and tips he throws in throughout the movie are so glaringly obvious the second time round that you wonder how you could have missed them. And all the time he never loses the focus of the story. As Spacey said accepting his Oscar, if Soze does exist then it has to be Singer as he's the one that pulls the strings.

And then there is 'that' ending. The ending which will have newcomers gasping out loud and veterans smirking at the cleverness of it all. The ending that 100 years of predictable cinema has taught you never to expect has finally arrived and it was worth waiting every second for. The final line simply chills you to the bone.

The bottom line is that it was Suspects that deserved the awards that Braveheart got. The Academy will smugly sit back and tell us that the better film won. Those that have seen know differently.

title: What the --?
review:
Superb performances. Brilliantly-paced storytelling. Direction that's maybe not quite as accomplished as it first seems, but is certainly good enough to do the needful.

It's the plot that makes the film though. It's magnificent. Those who lean back, bloated by their own sense of self-importance, and nonchalantly claim to have "gotten" the twist just don't get it. Or rather, they're falling for it. None of the questions raised by the film are answered. Not in any reasonable way. The plot is a web of lies, which saves what is potentially the biggest lie of all for the very end. It's wonderfully knowing, and it superbly leads the audience on a merry dance.

Who is Kaizer Soze? Don't let those who claim to know fool you. To this day, nobody knows for sure. That's the beauty of this film. And as films go, it's very beautiful indeed.

title: All I have to say is "Whoah"
review: Wow, what a great ending! Never before has a movie left me saying "Oh my god!" as my jaw hits the floor. Of all the movies I've seen, The Usual Suspects probably has the one of the coolest and most complicated plots. It took me three sittings before I finally got the whole gist of what was going on. But the movie is so good and the characters are so cool, that I wanted to keep watching it. Usually when I rent a movie, I watch it once, maybe twice, but never three times. The Usual Suspects changed that streak.

title: One of the best crime movies of our time
review:
If you haven't seen this one, then you must make time to do so. From start until finish, this one will leave you guessing until the end. Kevin Spacey and the rest of the cast does an astonishing job partraying the characters in this modern day mystery.

If you have seen it please, please don't tell anyone the ending. FANTSTIC!!!!!

title: Brilliant
review:
Wow, this is probably the best mystery I have ever seen. The Usual Suspects is a movie in which you must pay close attention to every detail, and I love movies like that.

The Good: Everything about this movie is so well done that I can't say enough about it. It is full of action and drama, with a little comedy twisted in. All of the characters are great, and the actors depicted this characters very well. Kevin Spacey was brilliant, and he fit his role perfectly. As far as directing goes, I don't think The Usual Suspects could have been directed any better. The end is great, and I love putting every piece in its place (although I had to watch it a few times before I got everything straight).

The Bad: The movie was perhaps a little too unbelievable. Kevin Spacey was perhaps a little too smart. Otherwise, I cannot find many, if any more flaws in the movie.

Overall: 10/10

title: 100% Praise
review:
Well, What can I say, This film got a 10 from me and it is totally deserving.

The tone of the story - the mystery of Soze, they say that the Sixth Sense has the best twist ever. No chance. I only know one person who worked this film out.

I think the depth Benecio brought to the film was a blessing - It always amazes me that he has so little recognition in the long run. Every role I see him play is so radically different, the energy, character, voice, gestures. He doesnt be the character on the paper, he is absorbed into the character in life.

Another class performance from Spacy... well another... by this point it wasnt another, but a class performance nonetheless.

Bryne is another underrated actor I feel, watching his shady Keaton in this film.

Direction... was any needed with half the cast? The Point of View the camera gave was always good as well, slowly bringing important facts around a corner or over a building...

I'm babbling now. One of my top 5 movies without a doubt.

title: A near-perfect whodunit
review: "The Usual Suspects" is a movie which stil holds great mystery for me. Though I saw it several times in the theater and own the DVD, I still seem to notice something new every time I view the film.  This is the mark of a great movie.  I am not the greatest at anticipating plot twists in movies, but I do not believe any of my friends when they say that they correctly predicted the ending of "The Usual Suspects".  I don't want to say any more than this -- for those who haven't seen it, it would be spoiling.  Just know that this is perhaps the greatest crime-thriller/mystery ever filmed.

title: Good the first 20 times
review: I watched this movie about 20 times and thought it was one of the best movies ever.  However, I recently rented it and I honestly had trouble making myself sit through it.  Need to watch it but don't be surprised if it gets old after a while.

title: More twists than a ton of spaghetti.
review: This is truly a cracking film that plays on the expectation of the audience. Five crooks are brought together in a contrived line-up that gets them talking of revenge afterwards. Spacey gives a great turn as 'Verbal' Kint in a role which should have nabbed him Best Actor, never mind that Supporting Actor Oscar. Each of the actors plays a well rounded character and none of them can be found to be at fault in their portrayals of their respective people. Singer tells the story in a twisting way that may confuse a little, although usually youll understand what's happening moments afterwards. A cracking yarn.

title: INCREDIBLE MOVIE!!! INCREDIBLE FILM MAKING!!!
review: There are no words to describe this movie.  I've seen this movie about 5 times and I still Can't believe the ending.  If you haven't seen this movie, see it now.  You're missing out on one of the best movies ever made. Bryan Singer is a genius.

title: SUPREME!
review: It is (without thinking it twice) the best movie iÂ´ve ever seen in my hole life. It has an outstanding performance by Kevin Spacey. An incredible plot and exceptional characters. This is one of those films which you enjoy every second of it (I did). It also has a very good score. Anyway this one is a must see.

title: Perfection on a screen!
review: This film is PERFECT, as in it has no flaws (at least none that I can see). Everybody in it seems to actually be their characters. Kevin Spacey deserved his Oscar for best actor by far. Gabriel Byrne was, and is, a master. I put this film in my top 10 easily.

title: Do not read, just watch it...
review: "Usual Suspects" is a brilliant crime-puzzle to the last minute. The actors did a great job and especially Gabriel Byrne and Kevin Spacey are irresistible. Unexpected epic-turns and seemingly unrelated stories only underline the global impression. This is a 100% 9/10. Enjoy.

title: One of the greatest psycho-logical thrillers ever made!
review:
This movie rocks! It's filled with such great performances. Especially by Kevin Spacey and Gabriel Bryne. I'm very surprised Bryne didn't receive a nomination for this. The story is brilliant. It's so original and unique. The movie is very confusing however. It just toys with your mind. It plays with it. Did I figure this movie out? Hell no! But hopefully, after several more viewings, I will. "The Usual Suspects" is like a maze, and the viewer is like a mouse looking for the piece of cheese. But eventually, the mouse becomes confused, without knowing how to figure the maze out. This accurately describes this film.

Grade: 9/10

title: A great thriller
review: Most of you reading this have probably seen The Usual Suspects but for those of you that haven't I wont give anything away. All I'll say is that The Usual Suspects is a supremely intelligent film and one of the best thrillers ever made, and although it loses some of its impact on its second viewing, it still deserves to be watched multiple times.

title: Magnificent
review: The Usual Suspects is probably one of the most clever, brilliant, and absolute magnificent movies I have ever seen.  Everything about this movie is good.  Kevin Spacey's First Oscar winning performance is the best of his career.  The Entire cast shines also shines.  Benicio Del Tero is over the top (In a good way) as Fred Feinster.  The Evocative and gripping score pulls you in and is really suspensful.  Christopher McQuarie's Screenplay is one of the best ever written.  The ending is probably the best ending I've ever seen.  If you are ever at a video store, rent or buy The Usual Suspects.  YOU WILL LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: genious at work
review:
I read the plot and was interested, but not fascinated. After I'd seen this movie, I was it. It's nearly unbelievable for me how perfect the cast was chosen and how thrilling the plot was directed.

For me this movie is one of the best ever made, watch, be surprised and enjoy it, once, twice ...

title: Cleverest movie ever shot.
review: The first time I watched this movie a couple of years I was a little apprehensive as to whether I'd like it or not, a few hours later I was absolutely taken aback by the quality of this movie. I have now seen 'The Usual suspects' about five times and it still remains one of the cleverest and most entertaining movies I have ever seen. **SOME SPOILERS** It starts out with an explosion at a harbor then jumps back six weeks to explain how this event came to happen. The story is told by Verbal Kint (Kevin Spacey)and the tale he tells weaves across America from a line-up in New York to a harbor in California. The film constantly throws you red herrings and as each layer of the story is added the audience is tricked into believing a story which may or may not be true. The final revelation has to go down as one of the best plot twists of all time, leaving the audience feeling confused but that's the beauty of it, we then have to go back through the story, which parts are true and which are false. **END OF SPOILERS** The performances of all the actors in this film are incredible, Kevin Spacey was extremely deserving of the Supporting actor award, but the whole cast are fabulous: Gabriel Byrnes (Keaton), Kevin Pollack (Hockley), Benicio Del Toro (Fenster) and especially Steven Baldwin (McManus) are wonderful in this movie. This film is definitly one of my favorite films and I urge everyone to rush out and watch it. If you like clever mvoies which don't simply cater to the popcorn-blockbuster audience then you will LOVE 'The Usual Suspects' 10 out of 10, a masterpiece of modern film-making.

title: Who is Keyser Soze?
review: If you like films with twists at the end (e.g. The Sixth Sense, Fight Club) then this is the film for you!!! 9/10 for great story line and acting although it can get very confusing at times.

title: The Best Written Movie of All-Time
review: THE USUAL SUSPECTS is undoubtedly the greatest written masterpiece in history. The ending is absolutely phenomenal and it, in itself, is the finest movie ending ever, alongside that of THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION. If you have not seen the film, do so as you will not be disappointed. ****/**** !!

title: One Question
review:
First of all, I just want to say that "The Usual Suspects" was incredible. It was one of the best movies I've ever seen. I just watched it and am at a loss for words right now.

I have just one question I'd like to ask for now: What idiots had the guts to even rate the film below a 9? I would even say that 9 was a stretch. If the people who voted below 9 are a whole bunch of romance-lovers, or plotless action flick-lovers, or simply people who weren't intelligent enough to understand it, than we should simply disregard their vote and acknowledge what the real rating should be (which is 10).

title: The Only Perfect Movie Ever to Be Made
review:
SPOILER

I read some other comments, and one man declared that The Usual Suspects lied to the viewers, and that it went against the whole basis of film making. The thing is, The Usual Suspects changed the plot diagram, lied to the audience, and yet not one line spoken, not one note in the music, not one camera angle, and not one element of the story is wrong. John Ottman's music is ideal. It is subtle during the building plot, and when you know Verbil Kint is not exactly Verbil Kint, well then the music hits off once Chazz Palmentari or however you spell it drops his coffee mug, and even then it is not too epic. The plot diagram was changed since there is a climax, then a short resoultion, and then another ending. First it is Dean Keaton, and then it is Verbil Kint. And the whole time the movie is a lie. The whole point was that the movie was a lie. We saw a story in a movie that never even happened. We can't even guess what actaully happened and what Keyser Soze did. But like in the end, we know Kobayashi exists, and that there is a middleman. Pete Postelshwate or however you spell it picks up Soze outside the police department. It is hilarious, but keeps a calm tone. The camera angles and the whole style is film-noir. And the best thing about it all is that it does make sense in the end. The more you try to figure it out, the more you do figure it out. I have seen the movie a thousand times and I know what happens. You watch it a thousand times, and you will know. And best for last, in the first scene, you know Dean Keaton isn't Keyser Soze, so the movie is never unbelievable...

title: Borrowed Plot
review: I liked this movie very much but am surprised that in all the reviews and comments I have read about it, there have been no references to the Eric Ambler novel and 1944 Movie "The Mask of Dimitrios".  'SUSPECTS' is probably the better movie, with a bigger budget and better production, but the older film with Zachary Scott, Sidney Greenstreet and Peter Lorre had a more authentic noir feel.

title: A film need to see a couple of times.
review: I first saw this film in the movie theater when it was first release. The Usual Suspects is a type of movie you see, but the plot moves fast and dialogue has a lot of hidden meanings you need to see it twice. There are five guilty people and rounding up by the police for a line up. The police are trying to find Keyser Soze but not who he is or look like. There are so many twists in the plot it is hard to catch them all. It worth watch more than once.

title: The Best Thriller
review: For me, it's better than Psycho (or whatever else is considered the best Thriller of all times). I can assume that this movie's effect is similar to the Hitchcock's at his time, but I leave now and this movie works for me better than Notorious or North by Northwest.

title: My favorite of all time!
review: The Usual Suspects weaves a plot that is so complex, original, and surprising.  I have heard people say that they were not surprised by the ending.  I find that extremely hard to believe.  I was blindsided by the ending. Anyway, the movie is one of the most intelligently written movies that I have ever seen.  I would love to spend an hour inside the mind of the writer, Christopher McQuarrie.  No wonder he won an Academy Award for his screenplay. About the plot, I don't want to reveal too much, in case you have not seen it.  It is mainly just a crime/mystery/thriller, but so much more.  If nothing else, see the movie just for the revelation at the end of the movie.

title: Worth Watching<<
review:
Film Review

This film was by a relatively unknown director called Bryan Singer, who directed other films like X-Men, the science fiction classic of 2000. However, the relative anonymity of the director did not in any way hamper the popularity or the acclaim of the film. In many ways, the style is very similar to Tarantino's films, in that the film does contain many violent scenes, and is in many ways a look at the less shiny acclaimed side of petty crime. However, there is one crucial difference: in Tarantino's films violence is both society and media is explored in a very similar way to Stanley Kubrick, while in this film, violence is used as a dramatic device, i.e. to present the audience with visually impressive scenes. The story is seemingly simplistic, and is, in a break from cinematic tradition, told via the medium of a narrator, who narrates through the action, with frequent cuts back to him as a frame of reference. However, the use of a narrator does not hamper the action, instead it highlights the events you see taking place.

The film is based entirely on audience expectation. A mystery is presented to us, then unravelled, but, before the final piece is in place, it shatters every thing the audience thought they knew or understood. This makes it an unusual film, as twist endings, though fairly common, are never truly effective, except in certain films, and those all follow a specific formula, e.g. Hitchcock's Psycho, among others sets up a murder where the culprit is obvious, then proceeds to make you realise that nothing is really as it seems. The murderer is someone completely different, and the confidence built up in the audience is quite abruptly shattered. The very same idea is behind The Usual Suspects. The story told seems consistent, and seems true, but there are little details. Then, when all is revealed, you feel shocked, and almost tricked, but not in a bad sense. It has been said by many classical directors that a twist ending is shallow, and fake, and is not the true ending for a film which uses a mystery as a plot device. I do not necessarily agree with this view. While it is true that many films which use twist endings are quite bad: The sixth sense is an example, some of the best films have been made thanks to them, like the fairly recent film Memento, whose twists are fascinating.

title: fuss?
review: I don't know why there's all this fuss made about it - I guessed what was going to happen in the first MINUTE of the movie. It was SO  predictable, especially with the guys at the start when they did the thing. Honestly, don't filmakers make films for intelligent people anymore?  I'm tired of second guessing films from the title. Battleship Potemkin was the same deal. Come on Hollywood! Surprise me!

title: Wow
review: Everyone should have seen this movie! Brilliant! The script is brilliant, the acting is brilliant, the direction is brilliant. Everything is brilliant about this movie. That's why: 10/10

title: the best suspense film ever
review:
This is my favorite film at the moment i bought it on vhs not long ago - it actually took me a while to find it and it was worth it. It is one of those films that keeps you guessing, and although you may be half way through the film and you think you've got the ending sorted, you'll probably change your mind about 5 times before the end of the film as to who you believe Keyzer Sozer to be. It is not a film that is easily sussed.

The cast is fantastic, Gabriel Byrne, Kevin Spacey, Stephen Baldwin, Benicio Del Toro and Kevin Pollock work well together and Spacey fully deserved his oscar for best supporting actor. The script is one of those that on paper probably makes you think "this will never work" but it does and is one of the most complex films i have watched for a while.

It will always be remembered for the line up scene which was in a way a mistake as the cast couldn't stop laughing at each other but it was decided that it be left in, and this, along with the boat scenes, is one of the best scenes of the film.

The film has a perfect ending to match a perfect build up to the climax and should definatley be watched by all crime/suspense/thriller fans everywhere!!

ps. and anyone else for that matter

title: a must-see 10/10
review:
Love it or hate it -- you'll never forget The Usual Suspects. A wonderful puzzle of a film that only improves after multiple viewings. Sure the twist at the end might not be completely concrete, but that's part of the film's charm.

Bryan Singer's direction is visually gorgeous, giving the film a surprisingly classic feel; plus the action scenes are given a realistic touch. The film is nicely acted -- Kevin Spacey shines as "Verbal Kent," but the real joy is Gabriel Byrne, who makes a wonderful leading man. Christopher McQuarrie is a brilliant screenwriter, as he would prove again with his masterful The Way of the Gun.

title: Outstanding cast, outstanding movie...
review:
One word comes to mind when I think of Usual Suspects; excellent. Besides the awesome plot twisting and spectacular cinematography, the cast ensemble is definitely one in a million. A definite must see twice film, it incorporates many aspects of previouly made suspenseful crime thrillers. For this genre of film, many others can not even hold a candle compared to this fast-paced thriller.

As mentioned before, the cast is superb. With such known faces as Stephen Baldwin, Benicio Del Toro and Pete Postlewaite, it is easy to infer that this film was filled with breathtaking performances. And yes, we can not forget the incredible Oscar winning performance from who else but the master of the discreetly evil men; Kevin Spacey.

The props and story arrangement were also an incredible part of this film (those who have seen it know what I mean). All in all, this is a definite late night movie to be viewed with great curiosity and close attention. And it would not be bad to watch it a few times because there is so much going on, it would be a shame to miss something significant.

title: Rent it!
review: Gabriel Byrne and Kevin Spacey fans will love it. I thought the story was actually a little predictable, but of the people I know that watched it...I am the only one. It is a twisty and intense film. I think it is worth the time and also the money. Rating: 7

title: One of the best movies and one of the best actors
review:
I was looking on the IMDb site and I saw The Usual Suspect standing #16. I looked at the story and I thought what so special about it, because it was a normal story. Nothing special, but it has to be special because it's on #16.

After I saw the movie I didn't believe the ending. It was strange and really perfect. That's why I gave it a 10.

It's about five guy's, one of them is Kevin Spacey, who take care of people. They are usual the suspects, but they can't be find when a ship has blown up. Only Kevin Spacey. Kevin Spacey explain what happened and then comes a great ending. I'm not telling the clue because than it isn't fine anymore to watch it.

It's one of the best movies and has the best actor in it.

title: The very modern thriller!
review: Great thriller movie, original, perfectly plotted, because only at the end the identity of the terrible criminal is revealed. And it is impossible to recognize him before, as the best thriller must do. Together with "Se7en" it is the best example of this genre in the '90. They are the reference for all the films of these times.

title: Only see this movie once
review:
If there was ever a movie that was composed of the perfect cast it was this one. Pollak, Baldwin, Del Toro, Byrne and Spacey give all give their best at this movie. The director, Bryan Singer made another excellent movie, Apt Pupil, but then chose to make a big (or at least a lot bigger) budget disappointment, the X-men. It had great actors in it (again!), but lacked a propper story (The senator should stay alive, because this way there won't be any sentinels).But enough about The X-men. This movie is what Singer will be forever known. But a word of caution, if you haven't seen it, do so, of course, but avoid seeing it again, because some minor mistakes in the story will make the experience less enjoyable.

But then again, who am I, your mother. 10/10

title: Kevin Spacey is magnificent!
review: This is a great movie that echos the classics from Hollywood's Golden Era. Kevin Spacey is great in his Oscar winning role.  And even though his part was technically considered a supporting role, he really steals the movie and makes it truly memorable.  I highly recommend "The Usual Suspects" to any movie fan!

title: Great except for one thing...
review: This will be a short comment.  The movie the first time I watched it was great except for the fact that I had a suspicion of "the ending" in the first 20 minutes and would have bet my house on that during the scene at the pool table where they get "recruited".  Even with that--this is an awesome movie worth watching multiple times.

title: The Usual Movie? Far From It
review: What to say about this movie: it feels like a gem, a one-piece jewel with perfect contours and precise craftsmanship. Some movies (books, plays, etc) will shoot all over the place, trying to please everybody, losing its soul in the process. The Usual Suspects is so concentrated towards a goal it is enshrouded into itself, which is what a flawless work of art should be. The characters exist only for this story, it appears; the world the filmmakers create seems at once from this world and independent from any known point of reference, which is what any good avant-garde movie should claim. On a more down to earth, technical level, the rhythm and the editing look and sound like a piece of music which start with a slow bang, let you float for a while but never linger in limbo, rather make you wonder constantly, which is also what the acting of Kevin Spacey does so well. The five main characters feel they're being controlled by somebody else, but so will you: the filmmakers are leading you where they want. Singer is a master at manipulating the different aspects of the movie and, in the process, us. Watch it more than once.

title: Strap In
review:
A movie like The Usual Suspects is one that you watch the first time by yourself, and at the end, you feel stupid for letting yourself be drawn in to such a perfect story. The next time you watch it, you make sure to bring a friend. You know a movie like this is not one to be kept to yourself, and that it needs to be shared. Although the movie makes no definite conclusion, it still works because you know in the back of your mind the sick truth, and because of that you keep coming back.

Kevin Spacey shines as always, supported by an amazing story and a plethora of good actors. The movie can move from very serious to a side-splitting scene of hilarity at a breakneck speed, and the screenwriting was beautiful. Brilliantly executed, this movie is one of the greats.

title: Keokuk, IA
review:
Five years ago I rented a movie that many of my friends heralded as a masterpiece. They were right, but failed to include a few adjectives. I told the they should recomend the movie as a marvelous modern masterpiece.

After spending the $3.00 to rent it and roughly two hours to watch it, I realized that I had really not given this film its due. I sorely regretted not having seen it repeatedly in the theaters. Soon therafter I purchased the movie, and even though I watch it religiously, I still enjoy the ending. I can still see the ending turning out a different way.

The direction of this movie only furthered the writer's cause - it is mysterious and convincing. These two words are the only two relevant to how the direction effects the outcome of the entire crew's work. I like everythihg about it.

My one regret is that the part of Jack Baer is not played to its full extent. It seems in my mind that the outlook on the part in general is one of cockiness, which is actually fulfilled through many other parts. I feel that it deserved more attention to the concern felt for the job. We are not fully given any reason to believe that this man's attitude is based on anything concrete. Beyond that, the acting is flawless. I was totally sold on the part of Dean Keaton, and more over, I believed that each of the other four men were what I was lead to belive they were: criminals or con-artists.

I have his listed in my top 15 movies, so sitting next tot the likes of The Godfather series, Shawshank Redemption, and 10 others makes this movie one of the best out there in my estimation.

title: My new number 1 film, right before Shawshank.
review:
I saw this picture originally in the theatre. My girlfriend and I went outside and were heavily debating the nick in the end. All the way home we tried to specify which detail about the movie was actually real or didn't happen at all.

The first thing next morning we said to eachother was "In think I know now". After seeing it 5 times over we're still not sure whats real and whats just a story of Verbal.

For people who haver never seen the movie, you have mist the best movie yet. It's all there. Mystique camera shots, brilliant acting, a catching story and for me a movie which I can't stop talking about.

title: the Greatest
review: Simply put, the greatest yarn-spinner of all time.  When you bring all the elements of film together, it makes for great entertainment.  Brilliant acting, deft directing, an amazing plot and an ending like no other and you have simply put, the best film ever made.

title: do not let anyone tell you anything about this film until you have seen it.
review: watch and enjoy. this film will become a classic & some may say it already is. And remember do not let anyone tell you anything about it other than it is a good film and do not watch it with anyone who has seen it. i think you will be pleasantly surprised.

title: A jaw dropper
review: Kevin Spacey has a knack for being in movies where you just stare at the screen, amazed, at the end of the movie.  This one does not disappoint. This has got to be one of the best mystery movies of all time, and is worthy of anyone's collection.  Be sure to bring your thinking caps, though.

title: Overrated
review: The greatest trick the devil ever pulled was convincing the world that this was one of the greatest films of all time.  Seriously, I don't mean to call this a bad movie by any means - it was brilliantly written, with solid directing and great performances from an ensemble cast.  But ranking this movie as the fifteenth greatest in cinematic history is simply outrageous. Personally, I don't like ranking films according to their greatness - unless you've seen every film ever created it's a little difficult to judge, and even then, what grounds do you base your judgement on?  My point here is that every "top ten" list or "greatest of all-time" list should be taken with a grain of salt, or in this case, maybe a whole tablespoon.

title: An excellent whodunit
review: Kevin Spacey continues giving performances that are absolutely astounding. In this winding and twisting mystery, all bets are off as the movie works to a completely astonishing ending. Not to be overlooked are the exceptional performances by Benicio Del Toro, Stephen Baldwin, and Gabriel Byrnes, who all contributed enormously to this masterpiece. **** out of 4

title: Best movie i have ever seen
review:
Warning possible spoilers: rent no buy this movie then read this it's that good!!!!! The Usual Suspects is a movie that probably slipped through most people's radar when it came out in theaters but is a must see,no must have movie that any movie fan would be gratified to see.

The movie is about five criminals brought together under suspicious circumstances and in a decisive moment forming a bond that would lead them down a dark path of robbery,suspense and murder.

The script is nothing short of genius and Bryan Singer directs the movie in a way that will leave you thirsting for more.It's told through a continuous flow of flashbacks by a cripple named Verbal Kint,and cuts from flashback to present time seamlessly never leaving you feeling totally lost.The supporting cast in the movie is fantastic and the music adds to the gritty realism of the film.

The Usual Suspects is a new age marvel of a film that I found methodical and downright enticing.From beginning to end the movie never leaves you feeling disinterested or wanting to shut it off. The characters in the film played by Gabriel Byrne,Kevin Spacey,Stephen Baldwin,Benicio Del Toro and Kevin Pollack are crafty,seductive,and captivating.The acting and script are top notch and the twists and turns will leave you in utter shock.By the end of this movie you will want to watch it again to figure out how and why you possibly could have missed the ending and try to figure it out,but the movie is done so well you will just succumb to the realization that it is to good a movie and your mind has been beaten.

title: SIMPLY GREATNESS PERSONIFIED
review:
IN A WORLD WHERE NOTHING IS WHAT IT SEEMS, YOU'VE GOT TO LOOK BEYOND..

THE USUAL SUSPECTS SIMPLY FROM THE FIRST TO LAST SHOT ASKS YOU TO THINK WHAT IS REALITY AND WHAT IS NOT. I DIDN'T KNOW UNTIL THE VERY LAST SHOT WHAT WAS GOING ON AND I'M STILL NOT CERTAIN IF I KNOW NOW..

MUST BE SEEN..

title: a must-see
review: Most viewers will never forget the name 'Keyser Soze' . It is a legendary name now, as is this film. Great cast and acting, great story, great dialog, and the most clever film of that year. Together with 'Seven', this film launched Kevin Spacey into the top rung of Hollywood actors today. And don't overlook Benicio Del Toro as Fenster !

title: No interruptions please
review:
This is a very very good movie, great plot, great acting and a twist that comes right out from left field. Make absolutely sure that if you haven't seen this before, take the phone off the hook, ignore the doorbell, settle down and watch this without interruption. And even better, watch it again so you can see all the things you miss.

All I can say is "Enjoy and pass the popcorn"

title: The greatest trick the devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist.
review:
A tale of a person who is known by many as the Devil. A man with no remorse, no feelings, no conscience. A man with a gun. A man who would not hesitate to kill, regardless of who they might be. Friend, foe, ally, enemy - beware.

A fantastically written story, which leaves you sitting on the edge of your seat. 5 Criminals brought together for a line-up for a crime of stolen guns in Queens end up in the hands of the most terrifying criminal to ever walk the face of this planet. They soon learn why he is nicknamed "The Devil Himself"

title: Incredible
review: When anyone talks about the usual suspects, they always mention the ending. As good as it is, the rest of the film is a masterpiece too. The charactors are cool, stylish and funny, and during the film you really warm to them. I have seen this film so many times, but i'll never get bored of it because of the fantastic detail in every scene. Its beautifully shot, the script is brilliant and the storyline is engaging and complex without being too clever. Its fantastically acted, and while Kevin Spacey always gets the praise for his performance, Kevin Pollack and Benicio del Toro are also superb. Brian Singer has created a film that is riviting from start to finish. Everybody plays their part in a true modern classic. Theres only one thing left to mention.. who is keizer soze??

title: great, never saw the end coming!
review: this movie is one of kind that we don't see often enough. The twist at the end completely catches you off guard! Great plot and acting, especially on Kevin Spacey's part. although the beginning may be slow, the end is worth it!

title: The BEST Movie Climax Ever
review:
Contains Spoilers The best twist ending ever put on film. I grew up watching Alfred Hitchcock, Twilight Zone, Outer Limits, Ray Bradbury, The Hitchhiker, The Hunger, and any film or TV show of that genre. I can usually spot the twist coming long before it happens (I guessed the endings for The Sixth Sense in 22 minutes and Unbreakable in under an hour). The Usual Suspects totally blind-sided me.

Kevin Spacey deserved the Academy Award he received for best Actor for this portrayal crippled con man Roger 'Verbal' Kint. Verbal spins an intricate story, involving a powerful all star cast, that keeps you on the edge of your seat until the ending knocks you off your chair. I went to the theater 4 times and then purchased a copy of the movie. I have seen it a total of 59 times and I still can not connect all the dots as to what is real, what is a fabrication, who knew what and when they knew it.

If you are tired of the same old rehashed plot lines on the big screen you MUST buy this movie. It is not a breath of fresh air. It is a 450 mph -50 artic tornado hitting you full in the chest on a scorching hot August afternoon.

Here are a few examples of the questions I am have been dealing with. Even after all these viewing I have still come to no concrete conclusions.

The simplest of which is who is Keyser Soze?

Verbal tells a compelling story that the audience believes right up to the end, but Verbal admits he was in "County (jail). I was in for fraud." and Kobayashi (Pete Postlethwaite) tells the group "One of Mr. Soze less than intelligent couriers was taken in a complicated confidence scam by a cripple." Verbal makes a life out of telling believable stories in order to bend people to his will. Other than the Police line up and the boat explosion did anything else really happen? Maybe the rest of the team (Dean Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), Fred Fenster (Benicio Del Toro), Todd Hockney (Kevin Pollak), Michael McManus (Stephen Baldwin)) are alive, have split the money and are hiding out in Canada. Hey its Verbal's story, is it true or another con job?

Or is Verbal blowing a smoke screen to get out of prosecution? Agent Jack Baer (Giancarlo Esposito) gives a clue "A hex sign to keep people from f**king with you back when a name meant something." After meeting Kobayashi, Keaton says, "The guy is a pipe dream. This Kobayashi is using him for window dressing" or is Verbal using the Soze legend for window dressing.

Is Kobayashi really Keyser Soze and is Verbal one of his cronies? The only person who ever saw Kobayashi and is still alive is Verbal. If you believe Verbal's story. Did the pool room meeting ever take place? Edie Finneran (Suzy Amis) cannot be asked if she worked for Kobayashi on the extradition proceeding.

Soze is not Dean Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), he's dead right.?. Is Keaton still alive and Verbal is lying to the cops to throw them off the scent? Do Verbal and Kobayashi actually work for Keaton?

If you figure it all out let me know. One thing I do know is that if I ever meet Christopher McQuarrie (who rightly received the Academy Award for best screenplay) I will give him such a slap for making me think so hard. Never before (or since) have I ever put so much thought into a film.

title: Excellent!!!!!!!!!!!
review: This film speaks for itself. Kevin Spacy has once again come through with a perfect performance, I don't want to say anything specific about this film as you must see it but you will not be sorry you did. Finally a film made great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Good Film made even better by Ending twist
review:
Brian Singer and Chris McQuarrie made a good film. It was entertaining and had a good story. Without the ending, it would be just another bland movie, with the ending and Kevin Spacey's well deserved Oscar performance, this movie is catapulted into a modern cinematic classic.

See it for the Good story, direction and twisty ending.

title: A great movie that requires intense concentration, attentiveness, and open-mindedness.
review:
WARNING - POSSIBLE SPOILER! Please read no further if you are still in the mystery.

The solution to The Usual Suspects is up to the audience as far as determination of who is what and who.

Key questions and statements: "Who is Keyser Soze?" "You never knew, that was his power." "The greatest trick the Devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist." "One cannot be betrayed if one has no people." "There was a group of Hungarians that wanted their own mob. They realized that to be in power you didn't need guns, or money, or even numbers, you just needed the will to do what the other guy wouldn't." "Soze looks over the faces of his family then he shows those men a will, what WILL really was." "He tells them he would rather see his family dead than live another day after this." "No one ever really believes." "Keaton always said, "I don't believe in God but I'm afraid of him". "I believe in God and the only thing that scares me is Keyser Soze."

Roger "Verbal" Kint was Keyser Soze a/k/a The Devil. Evidence: conversation between the cop and the special agent regarding Verbal's immunity, "This whole thing has turned political. This guy is protected from up on high by the Prince of Darkness, take my word for it"; picture faxed to NYPD given as part of the testimony of the burn victim; the burn victim's testimony that he thinks they were buying people, not dope (souls being called in by the one to whom they owed and/or had allegiance), that he saw the Devil, looked him in the eye. "Who's the Devil?" he was asked and he responded, "Keyser Soze, he was in the harbor killing many men" and stated that he saw his face. Verbal's statement regarding the line-up, "Besides it was fun, I got to make like I was notorious"; Verbal's shape-shifting at the end of the movie (limp removed and hand straightened out).

Verbal ad-libbed much of his testimony to the special agent based on data he read off of the office wall bulletin board and from the bottom of a coffee cup, i.e., alias Redfoot, Kobayashi (there was a real being but his real name probably wasn't Kobayashi), Guatamala, Quartet - Skokie, Illinois, 'orca-fat guy', etc. What really happened during those six weeks is anybody's guess but the fact remains that they did show up at the boat and attempt to destroy non-existent cocaine, kill and be killed 27 people, and attempt to collect 91 million dollars. Verbal killed all three of his accomplices, note the statement by McManus, "Strangest thing".

The special agent lacked imagination and operated like any other cop, i.e., "To a cop, the explanation is never that complicated, it's always simple. There no mystery to the street, no archcriminal behind it all. If you've got a dead body and you think his brother did it, you're going to find out you're right."

A brilliant script. "The greatest trick the Devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist."

title: Finally, someone knows how to write a good ending.
review: If you watch movie after movie, with predicable plot twist after predictable plot twist, treat yourself to this.  And pay attention.  To absolutely everything.  The acting, the innuendo, the props, and all of the background. Then, when the final credits roll, you will have been rewarded with a tape that you want to rewind and watch all over again.

title: Ingenious & Expertly Acted
review:
Who is Keyser Soze?

Good question, and the answer will make your jaw fall flat on the floor.

The movie follows the testimony of Verbal Kint, the sole survivor of a deadly raid on a ship that was supposed to house $90 million worth of dope. McManus (Stephen Baldwin), Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), Fenster (Benicio Del Toro), Hockney (Kevin Pollak), and Kint himself were hired to retrieve the dope for "Keyser Soze." But who is he?

The Usual Suspects is one of the craftiest and most ingenious thrillers of the 1990's, or any decade. Christopher McQuarrie's screenplay was more than deserving of its Academy Award nomination. The same goes for Spacey's performance as Verbal Kint.

Plenty of crime/thrillers have come down the pike over the years, but what distinguishes The Usual Suspects is how the story is woven together. The story jumps back and forth in time quite often, but never once was I confused. It is ingenious the way it all comes together at the end.

And that ending.....oh boy. I think most regular moviegoers are familiar with the now legendary ending The Usual Suspects. Simply put, it has to be seen to be believed. Period.

An ingenious, very thought-provoking film. Highly recommended.

A+

title: WOW what a movie, incredible story, Kevin deserved tha award he's incredible
review: the only reason i watched this movie was because of the awesome cast little did i know this movie was awesome! my eyes were glued to the television! this had great thrilling moments, cool action, one of the best stories, and an awesome cast. if you want a thrilling movie must see this movie even the person who's says movies don't shock them will be shocked, so many twists in the story its so cool i love this movie!

title: Smart, cool, and innovative.
review: One of the best crime movies ever, and the best of the last couple of decades. A fantastic cast, and even better directing. Not to mention one of the best conclusions to a movie, ever. More movies should be made with the quality of this one. Truly set a new standard in motion pictures.

title: cheap thrill ending?
review:
spoilers:

Should this movie be considered a cheap-thrill-ending movie because there is no real allusion to the ending through out the entire movie? It's definitely arguable, because any director could put the exact same ending on any movie and it would always be surprising that a complex story could be simply ad libbed. I disagree however, and think that the confusion results from an unwarranted comparison between other trick-ending movies like 'fight club' and the 'sixth sense.' In these movies, the viewer's understanding of a seemingly simple plot is destroyed at the end. The movie is actually quite complex and there is trail of evidence supporting the new ending. Only the end-perspective gained can explain everything. But in 'the usual suspects,' both perspectives (Spacey telling the truth or Spacey as Soza) explain everything in the movie. The only reason the latter explanation is chosen is to demonstrate this. Comparisons between 'usual' and 'fight/sixth' lacks the relevant similarity in movie structure.

title: Now this is a movie
review: Eureka.......This movie is gold. Everything was perfect in it's place: script, direction, acting, action and of coarse that notorious twist..... It also showcases the incredible versatility of one of Hollywood's genuine talents, Mr Kevin Spacey. Best crime thriller this decade.

Then all the sudden it went so quick, that I went back to the cinema the other day to watch the last half an hour again. I had to be sure I had not missed a thing. So "Oscar-worthy".

title: "The greatest trick the devil has ever pulled was convincing the world he doesn't exicst"
review:

The directmenship is amazing and i found my heart pounding really hard at several points of the movie (which only proves it's greatness). Now i can't really say more cause i want you guys to enjoy as much as i have, so let me just say this...

"Keaton always says he doesn't believe in god but he's still scared of him. Well i believe in god and the only thing that scares me is Kayzer Soyze"

For all the reasons above and some I might have missed --> this movie rated a whopping 9.2 on the lucid-o-meter (lu-sid-o-me-te-r)

review: No, don't watch this movie if you want to have a good time. I've never felt the need to warn people of such a crap boring movie before but this time it's unavoidable. Zero direction, no characterisation, no plot - even the soundtrack sucks. Get a life - watch anything else but this terrible moveie!!!

title: Undoubtedly a remarkable piece of work
review:
There seems to be little debate between movie critics that The Usual Suspects is one of the great works of the decade and, finally seeing it for myself, I found out why.

The Usual Suspects has very little wrong with it. Bryan Singer's direction is flawless, and it is accented by a host of outstanding performances all round. The characters are well written with significant development, and an outstanding aura of mistrust for each other in a time when they really should pull together. Spacey and Palminteri play a great double act as the witness/interrogator, which provides the narrative for the film.

The narrative itself is very well thought out, giving the audience just enough information to not leave them completely in the dark, but not giving them too much, in order to keep them guessing. The relatively complex plot could have easily gone astray with an overly complex narrative, but that doesn't happen.

The films main most powerful asset does lie in the well documented ending, which superbly edits together audio and visual effects to let the audience's jaw drop to the floor with disbelief. It is a truly brilliant piece of storytelling and film making, and will no doubt inspire a new wave of inadequate copycats.

All in all, The Usual Suspects is a triumph for anyone involved with it, but maybe just lacks a little something to earn it full marks.

*********

title: How good is The Usual Suspects?!?!?!?!.....
review:
........Very, very good. Outstanding if anything. I have watched this film over 10 times in the last year and ever time something new shines from the film.

The acting is outstanding, so much heart and soul. A low budget movie with a brilliantly fantastic and twisting plot I can imagine how much actors/actresses would want/demand to be in this film. The players give all the characters their own story.

The direction of the film is as good as any film I have ever seen, the film progresses in backflash's but it works within the story leaving me still stunned at how clever everything is about the film.

After watching this film so many times it has really sunk in how clever the dialogue really is. I still find bits of dialogue that make me think 'of course' or 'I didn't realise that...', truly stunning!

I really don't know what else to say about the film............all I can say is that it is....most definatley my favourite film ever. A clear 10/10 from me.

title: I love it
review:
Wow. What a ride . The Usual Suspects shows off the amazing talents of Kevin Spacey , Pete Postlethaite and my personal fave. Gabriel Byrne .

The characters lead you through a maze of twists and turns silently taking over your mind and manipulating you into believing what you see . title: Easily, THE best twist ending of all time!
review: With an all-star cast of Kevin Spacey, (Oscar winner, and deservingly, I will add) Benicio Del Toro (future Oscar winner), Stephen Baldwin, and Gabriel Byrne this movie delivers in an original way. It's ending goes down as the best twist ending in any movie to date, contested only by the new movie Memento. This is an A+ movie, 10/10. Recommend for all (except small children).

title: Defines Stylish
review:
This picture defines stylish. The structure of the script is terrifically clever. and an astonishing amount of plot is presented in a relatively short time. The cast is excellent. However, although the particular mechanism of the final twist is interesting, anyone who didn't see (or at least suspect) it doesn't go to too many films.

I believe the real appeal of the picture is the identification with the criminal mastermind Keyser Sose; monstrously evil types have exercised a fascination for audiences since Christopher Marlowe. But ultimately that is pretty shallow stuff. The picture gets an A+ for style, a B - or C for substance.

title: Another Clue! Any thoughts?
review:
(SPOILER INFORMATION, PLEASE DO NOT READ IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO KNOW THE ENDING OF THE MOVIE!)

One of the most subtle clues to who Keyser Soze might be, can be seen in one of the scenes that shows the informant who is on the boat.

One of the shots begins with the camera focusing on a black brimmed hat and long black coat hanging on the wall. The camera then moves down to show the scared informant sitting on the bed.

THE KEY IS; the hat and the coat are presumably the same clothing that Keyser Soze was wearing throughout the flashback scenes on the boat. The director started the informant scene with this shot to SHOW us something!!!!

What this means is that whoever Keyser Soze is; he must have put on the clothing after entering the room and shooting the informant.

1. We know it was no one working on the boat who killed the informant and later put on the clothing. They were hired to protect him.

2. We know it wasn't any of the Usual Suspects. Keaton and the rest of the crew were all killed. And according to Verbal, he even saw Keaton being killed.

3. So, the only person left that could have entered the boat, killed the informant, and then put on the black hat and coat, would have been Verbal!

If you were quick enough to pick up that clue during the movie, it would have been possible to know that Verbal was Keyser Soze long before the end of the movie.

That's my "two cents worth"!

Any thoughts?????
